Actually for anyone checking this thread later,you cannot use

```
require('module').globalPaths.push(__dirname + '/node_modules');
```

as this then messes up the require for electron modules, you need to use
the injected module object that already exists in the window context, so

```
module.paths.push(__dirname+'/node_modules');
```

I'm running into this issue when I try to run my Electron app on Windows. The Electron app executes perfectly fine on OSX.

On Windows my Electron app isn't able to find the `gaze` node module which I've included in my [`index.html`](https://github.com/phonegap/phonegap-app-desktop/blob/0.2.0/www/index.html#L19) file.

I've tried adding `var gaze = require('gaze').globalPaths.push(__dirname + '/node_modules');` and also `var gaze = require('gaze').paths.push(__dirname+'/node_modules');` but both of them throw errors stating that the `push` method can't be executed on an undefined or null object.
